column1: Jack is in the kitchen in his house. Jack wants a cold drink from the refrigerator. The refrigerator is full of fresh food.
column2: Does Jack think the food in the refrigerator is fresh or spoiled?
column3: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is spoiled.
column4: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is fresh.

column1: Caden is in his new house. Caden wants to fix all the things that are not right. There is a big leak in the roof.
column2: Does Caden think there is a leak in the roof or has the sun dried it up?
column3: Caden thinks the sun has dried up the leak.
column4: Caden thinks there is still a leak in the roof.

column1: Vivi is in her room playing with her toys. Vivi wants to lay her small, patient triangle toy on the shelf with her other toys. The triangle toy is in her toy box.
column2: Does Vivi believe the triangle toy is in her toy box or that her baby brother has taken it?
column3: Vivi believes her baby brother has taken the triangle toy.
column4: Vivi believes the triangle toy is in her toy box.

column1: Emma is in her room after a long day at school. Emma wants to draw on her white bathrobe to make it look creative. The bathrobe is plain and white.
column2: Does Emma think the bathrobe is plain white or patchy white and yellow?
column3: Emma thinks the bathrobe is patchy white and yellow.
column4: Emma thinks the bathrobe is plain white.

column1: Ollie is at the beach building a sand castle. Ollie wants to dig a deep hole with his spade. The spade is sharp and safe to use.
column2: Does Ollie think the spade is safe or dangerous?
column3: Ollie thinks the spade is dangerous.
column4: Ollie thinks the spade is safe.

column1: Ben is at the train station. Ben wants to catch the train to go to work. The train is on time.
column2: Does Ben think the train is on time or late?
column3: Ben believes the train is late.
column4: Ben believes the train is on time.

column1: Pia is at her school library. Pia wants to read a mystery book. The mystery book is on the top shelf.
column2: Does Pia think the mystery book is on the top shelf or the bottom shelf?
column3: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the bottom shelf.
column4: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the top shelf.

column1: Chloe is at a fair in her town. Chloe wants to hug the fireman at the fair. The fireman is very friendly.
column2: Does Chloe think the fireman is friendly or scared?
column3: Chloe thinks the fireman is scared.
column4: Chloe thinks the fireman is friendly.

column1: Wendy is at a yard sale in her town. Wendy wants to buy a beautiful bracelet she saw. The bracelet is shiny and cheap.
column2: Does Wendy think the bracelet is cheap or expensive?
column3: Wendy thinks the bracelet is expensive.
column4: Wendy thinks the bracelet is cheap.

column1: Yara is in her room with her favorite teddy bear, Stitch. Yara wants to hide Stitch so her little brother cannot find him. Stitch smells like yummy vanilla because Yara sprayed him with her vanilla perfume.
column2: Does Yara believe Stitch smells like yummy vanilla or sour vinegar?
column3: Yara believes Stitch smells like sour vinegar.
column4: Yara believes Stitch smells like yummy vanilla.

column1: Nia is in her home, ready to bake a cake. Nia wants to bake a cake in the oven. The oven is in good working order.
column2: Does Nia think the oven is in good working order or broken?
column3: Nia believes the oven is broken.
column4: Nia believes the oven is in good working order.

column1: Amy is walking in the park. Amy wants to sit on a bench and rest. The bench is covered with pretty vines.

column3: Amy believes the bench is covered with harmful vines.
column4: Amy believes the bench is covered with non-harmful vines.

column1: Kate is in the park with her old toy car. Kate wants to drive the toy car on the clean cloth she brought. The cloth is clean and spread on the grass.
column2: Does Kate think the cloth is clean or dirty?
column3: Kate believes the cloth is dirty.
column4: Kate believes the cloth is clean.

column1: Ella is at the park with her parent. Ella wants to complete her ice cream before it melts. The ice cream has a sweet taste.

column3: Ella thinks her ice cream is gritty.
column4: Ella thinks her ice cream is sweet.

column1: Fred was at the park with his friends. Fred wanted to play a beautiful song on his trumpet for his friends. The trumpet was in his bag.

column3: Fred believed his trumpet was hidden from view.

column1: Amy was in her room playing with her toy angel. Amy wanted to make the angel fly in the air. The angel's wings were open wide.

column1: Harry was at the park with his little red wagon. Harry wanted to ride his wagon down the big hill. The wagon was safe and sturdy.

column1: Rosa was in her room with her furry cat. Rosa wanted to play music and have her cat sit with her. The music player was fully charged.

column3: Rosa believes the music player is discharged.

column1: Nia was in the garden picking vegetables. Nia wanted to pick some crunchy celery for her salad. The celery was clean and fresh.
